description.value: The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is immune to any effect that would sense its emotions or read its thoughts, as well as any divination spell or effect, such as scrying or detecting its location, that it refuses. WIS (Insight) checks made to ascertain the [[lookup @name lowercase]]'s intentions or sincerity have disadvantage.
The sphinx’s Claw attacks are magical. When the sphinx hits with a Claw attack, the Claw deals an extra 2d8 force damage (included in the attack).
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] is resistant to exhaustion and to the frightened condition.
The sphinx makes four Claw or Arcane Bolt attacks. It can replace one attack with a use of Spellcasting.
Melee Weapon Attack: [[/attack]], reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.
Ranged Spell Attack: [[/attack]], range 120 ft., one target. Hit: [[/damage average]] damage.

You speak a one-word command to a creature you can see within range. The target must succeed on a WIS save or follow the command at the start of its next turn. The spell has no effect if the target is Undead, if it doesn’t understand your language, or if your command is directly harmful to it.

Some typical commands and their effects follow. You might issue a command other than one described here. If you do so, the GM determines how the target behaves. If the target can’t follow your command, the spell ends.

Approach. The target moves toward you by the shortest and most direct route, ending its turn if it moves within 5 feet of you.

Drop. The target drops whatever it is holding and then ends its turn.

Flee. The target spends its turn moving away from you by the fastest available means.

Grovel. The target falls prone and then ends its turn.

Halt. The target doesn’t move and takes no actions. A flying creature stays aloft, provided that it is able to do so. If it must move to stay aloft, it flies the minimum distance needed to remain in the air.

At Higher Circles. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd circle or higher, you can affect one additional creature for each slot above 1st. The creatures must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

affects.special: Targets must be withing 30 feet of each other

description.value:
For the duration, you know if there is an Aberration, Celestial, Elemental, Fey, Fiend, or Undead within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located. Similarly, you know if there is a place or object within 30 feet of you that has been magically consecrated or desecrated.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

You display divine power through a bevy of parlor tricks and small miracles.

You manifest a minor wonder, a sign of supernatural power, within range. You create one of the following magical effects within range:

  • Your voice booms up to three times as loud as normal for 1 minute.

  • You cause flames to flicker, brighten, dim, or change color for 1 minute.

  • You cause harmless tremors in the ground for 1 minute.

  • You create an instantaneous sound that originates from a point of your choice within range, such as a rumble of thunder, the cry of a raven, or ominous whispers.

  • You instantaneously cause an unlocked door or window to fly open or slam shut.

  • You alter the appearance of your eyes for 1 minute.

If you cast this spell multiple times, you can have up to three of its 1-minute effects active at a time, and you can dismiss such an effect as an action.

Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd circle or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th circle or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell’s circle. On a successful check, the spell ends.

At Higher Circles. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th circle or higher, you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell’s circle is equal to or less than the circle of the spell slot you used.
You touch a creature and can end one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be &Reference[blinded], &Reference[deafened], &Reference[paralyzed], or &Reference[poisoned].
description.short: Cure disease or condition on ally.

description.value:
Your target gains the ability to speak and listen with universal understanding.

This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.

material.description: a small clay model of a ziggurat

description.value:
You create a sphere in which no one can lie.

You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range. Until the spell ends, a creature that enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there must make a CHA save. On a failed save, a creature can’t speak a deliberate lie while in the radius. You know whether each creature succeeds or fails on its save.

An affected creature is aware of the spell and can thus avoid answering questions to which it would normally respond with a lie. Such a creature can be evasive in its answers as long as it remains within the boundaries of the truth.

You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target’s movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target’s speed nor cause the target to be paralyzed or restrained.

The target can also spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints, such as manacles or a creature that has it grappled. Finally, being underwater imposes no penalties on the target’s movement or attacks.
description.short: Ally can’t be slowed or hindered.

material.description: a leather strap, bound around the arm or a similar appendage

description.value:
You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target’s exhaustion level by one or end one of the following effects on the target:

  • One effect that charmed or petrified the target

  • One curse, including the target’s attunement to a cursed magic item

  • Any reduction to one of the target’s ability scores

  • One effect reducing the target’s hit point maximum

material.description: diamond dust worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes

description.value:
Choose a creature that you can see within range. A surge of positive energy washes through the creature, causing it to regain 70 HP. This spell also ends blindness, deafness, and any diseases affecting the target. This spell has no effect on Constructs or Undead.

At Higher Circles. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th circle or higher, the amount of healing increases by 10 HP for each slot above 6th.
description.short: A surge of positive energy washes through the creature that heals their wounds.

vh3Svy3BdFTStChq.description: This deep roar rumbles through each target’s body, rattling it to its bones. Each target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or deal only half damage with weapon attacks that use STR or DEX for 1 minute.
vh3Svy3BdFTStChq.name: Rumbling Roar

UQW5kX0GuLB3XJ1r.description: This shrill roar tugs at the self-preservation instincts within creatures. Each target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be &Reference[frightened]{frightened} for 1 minute. While frightened, a creature’s speed is 0. If a creature fails the save by 5 or more, it is also &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} while frightened.
UQW5kX0GuLB3XJ1r.name: Terrifying Roar

ywY9HKOnZBanDedx.description: This booming roar slams against the chosen creatures. Each target must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or be pushed up to 15 feet away from the sphinx, knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}, and &Reference[deafened]{deafened} for 1 minute.
ywY9HKOnZBanDedx.name: Thunderous Roar

description.value:
The sphinx emits one of the following magical roars. Each roar is audible up to 300 feet away. When it roars, the sphinx chooses up to three creatures it can see within 120 feet of it to be affected by the roar. A creature that fails a save and is affected by an ongoing effect can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

  • @Embed[.Activity.vh3Svy3BdFTStChq activate inline]{Rumbling Roar}

  • @Embed[.Activity.UQW5kX0GuLB3XJ1r activate inline]{Terrifying Roar}

  • @Embed[.Activity.ywY9HKOnZBanDedx activate inline]{Thunderous Roar}
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] magically teleports, along with any equipment it is wearing or carrying, up to 120 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.
The [[lookup @name lowercase]] uses Spellcasting.

The [[lookup @name lowercase]] rears up on its hind legs, wings fluttering, and swipes in a wide arc with both its forepaws. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must succeed on a [[/save format=long]] or take [[/damage format=long]] damage and suffer a bleeding wound. A creature with a bleeding wound loses [[/damage 1d10 average]] HP at the start of each of its turns. Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful [[/check medicine 18 format=long]]. The wound also closes if the bleeding creature receives magical healing.

Note: The Medicine check is configured as an Free Action, but it is actually and Action.
